member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.AbpAspNetCoreMvcApplicationBuilderExtensions.UseMvcWithDefaultRouteAndArea(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,System.Action{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Routing.IEndpointRouteBuilder})
member.summary:
Adds MVC to the request execution pipeline with the following default routes:
- a default route named 'defaultWithArea' and the following template: '{area}/{controller=Home}/{action=Index}/{id?}'. - a default route named 'default' and the following template: '{controller=Home}/{action=Index}/{id?}'.
member.returns: A reference to this instance after the operation has completed.

member.name: P:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.AntiForgery.AbpAntiForgeryOptions.TokenCookie
member.summary: Use to set the cookie options to transfer Anti Forgery token between server and client. Default name of the cookie: "XSRF-TOKEN".

member.name: P:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.AntiForgery.AbpAntiForgeryOptions.AuthCookieSchemaName
member.summary: Used to find auth cookie when validating Anti Forgery token. Default value: "Identity.Application".

member.name: P:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.AntiForgery.AbpAntiForgeryOptions.AutoValidateFilter
member.summary: A predicate to filter types to auto-validate. Return true to select the type to validate. Default: returns true for all given types.

member.name: P:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.AntiForgery.AbpAutoValidateAntiforgeryTokenAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets the order value for determining the order of execution of filters. Filters execute in ascending numeric value of the property.

remarks.para: Filters are executed in a sequence determined by an ascending sort of the property.

The default Order for this attribute is 1000 because it must run after any filter which does authentication or login in order to allow them to behave as expected (ie Unauthenticated or Redirect instead of 400).
Look at for more detailed info.

member.name: P:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.AntiForgery.AbpValidateAntiForgeryTokenAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets the order value for determining the order of execution of filters. Filters execute in ascending numeric value of the property.

remarks.para: Filters are executed in an ordering determined by an ascending sort of the property.

The default Order for this attribute is 1000 because it must run after any filter which does authentication or login in order to allow them to behave as expected (ie Unauthenticated or Redirect instead of 400).
Look at for more detailed info.

member.name: P:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.ApiExploring.AbpRemoteServiceApiDescriptionProvider.Order
member.summary: The order -999 ensures that this provider is executed right after the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ApiExplorer.DefaultApiDescriptionProvider.

member.name: T:Volo.Abp.AspNetCore.Mvc.ApplicationPartSorter
member.summary: This class is used to align order of the MVC Application Parts with the order of ABP module dependencies.
